passages.text: Technology | IT Hardware & Networking

Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. © 2025. Evercore Group L.L.C. All rights reserved.
Technology | IT Hardware
Amit DaryananiSenior Managing Director, IT Hardware & Networking Analyst
Irvin Liu Victor Santiago Hannah Liu Director . Senior Associate Associate
- High level – 1) Servers are weak – esp in Americas. 2) PCs – are OK, but HP > DELL. 3) Storage – Remains stable to strong esp on AFA side, 4) AI spend – NO END IN SIGHT.

- DELL – Sizable sell off post print. Fear is AI empty calories. Message from dell @ core is – AI is going GREAT but rest of biz is struggling. Focus will be on how do we get margins up 250bps in H2 vs. H1 – Need server recovery + 1x costs going away + storage seasonality.

- psTG – Neck sprain – The vertical move of the stock was notable. Though we think some of this reflective of negative position into the print. My 2c → New CFO, so for you to guide for a notable acceleration in H2 things have to be really ramping up much better. Focus shifts to Accelerate + tech differentiation.
- NTAP – steady as it goes, AFA weakness at +6% was notable but driven by public + EMEA... ex that we think AFA growth around 10%+. Room to raise guide next QTR.
- HPQ – Ramp up on PC should sustain, question will be on H2 duablity. Also Print continues to hold up fairly well on margins esp. FCF will be the focus in H2.
1. ECO - ISM Manufacturing - Tues. 2nd
2. ECO - Durable Orders - Wed. 3rd
3. HPE - Hewlett Packard Enterprise Q2:25 EPS - Wed. 3rd
4. CRDO - Credo Technology Q1:26 EPS - Wed. 3rd
5. ECO - ADP Employment Survey - Thu. 4th
6. CIEN - Ciena Q3:25 EPS - Thu. 4th

8. ECO - Payrolls - Fri. 5th
- PSTG and STX were the top performers this week, up \(+41.4\%\) and \(+8.6\%\) , respectively.- DELL and FFIV were the lowest performers this week, down \(-6.3\%\) and \(-0.9\%\) , respectively.
1. IT Hardware/Networking – Key Highlights From Day 1 of The EVR ISI Semiconductor, IT Hardware & Networking Conference. 8/27
2. IT Hardware/Networking – Lateral Reads from NVDA Jul -qtr EPS. 8/27
3. IT Hardware/Networking – Key Highlights From Day 2 of The EVR ISI Semiconductor, IT Hardware & Networking Conference. 8/28
4. VRT – Thinking Through the Acquisition of Waylay NV. 8/26
5. DELL – Michael’s Long Game in Infrastructure, UPSIDE AHEAD. 8/28

ANET - Multiple Ways To Win: We met with Brendan Gibbs (Area VP, Product Line Management) and Rudolph Araujo (Senior Director of Marketing & Investor Advocacy). During investor meetings, ANET highlighted their multi- vector growth outlook for 2025 (+25%) driven by front end (customers looking to refresh/invest in front end infra), backend (expect to exceed \(\) 1.5B\(AI networking target with strength across key customers + neocodus), and campus/enterprise opportunities. Management also indicated that they are cautiously optimistic on the scale up opportunity for ethernet. While ANET has not quantified this opportunity, they see potential for it to be meaningful in 2027 (especially if there is more compute silicon diversity). Finally, we think enterprise remains a source of upside and notably that will extend beyond the campus opportunity.

Scale Up Opportunity for Ethernet: Although ANET has not quantified this opportunity, they view it as interesting market particularly if the industry sees some level of silicon diversity in AI beyond NVDA (NVLink currently the de facto standard in scale up). Cloud titans and other compute vendors are developing custom silicon and prefer to use a non- proprietary solution for scale- up. The company currently does not have an announced product related to scale up ethernet and does not expect the opportunity to be meaningful until 2027 at the earliest (IB was once the standard for scale out and that has shifted to ethernet; there is potential for a similar dynamic to occur within scale up). Tomahawk 6 might be a good option for non- NVLink scale up as well - ANET indicated that there are limited sales related to T6 but expects shipments to occur in H2:26 and for revenue to potentially ramp in 2027. Worth noting that cloud titan customers have not made the decision on scale up ethernet vs. other solutions such as UALink.

CDW- Prudent FY25 Guide; Multiple Upside Levers Ahead: We met with AI Miralles (CFO), Steven O'Brien (VP of IR), and Dan Cartwright. Management characterized growth in the last quarter as broadly balanced, with durable performance in networking and storage and server demand concentrated in large enterprises. Client devices delivered a sixth consecutive quarter of growth, driven primarily by the Windows 11 refresh rather than AI PCs—though management noted there is more room for growth with elevated ASPs as TTM PC revenue is \(\sim \$ 6.7B\) versus a \(\$ 8.2B\) peak. SMB spending remains resilient but focused on devices and cloud, while corporate demand is broader across solutions and services. Federal remains uneven with strength in Defense while Civilian is weaker. Gross margin for the full year is expected to hold in the \(\sim 22\%\) range (street at \(21.6\%\) ) while full- year FCF conversion is targeted at \(80 - 90\%\) . In terms of capital allocation, the company is focusing on services- led M&A and opportunistic buybacks within balance- sheet discipline.

Infrastructure and Storage Strength: Networking and storage remain durable categories with broad- based growth. Server demand for the company has been concentrated in large enterprises while other channels have yet to show the same breadth of server demand—and management indicated hopes of stronger and broader demand across customers in the coming quarters.

Federal Demand Remains Choppy: While State and Local remain steady, federal spending patterns remain choppy—especially in civilian agencies which is based on headcount. Defense demand, however, has been more stable. CDW expects federal friction to persist through H2, though there could be some upside if stabilization comes sooner. In the long term, DOGE efficiency needs should support more technology spending and management remains confident in being a partner for government customers as dynamics normalize.

STX - HAMRing Home- Durable Growth in the Al Era: We met with Gianluca Romano (Executive Vice President & CFO) and Shayne Hudson (SVP, IR). We walked away from the meeting feeling more positive about the company's positioning in the HDD market long- term roadmap. Specifically, STX is leaning into its leadership in HAMR technology, having already qualified three major cloud customers and expecting to qualify all top seven by next summer. Demand in the cloud segment remains strong with visibility extending 3- 4 quarters through BTO, while constrained supply ensures everything produced is sold, even as some demand shifts forward into future quarters. Margins are expected to expand with favorable mix and scale as HAMR adoption accelerates, while cost discipline, streamlined R&D, and a stable balance sheet support the company's commitment to returning \(75\%\) of FCF to shareholders. Longer term, Al and video workloads are reinforcing the structural role of HDDs in data architectures, with \(\sim 90\%\) of data expected to remain on disk.

WDC- Favorable Dynamics Stacking Up: We met with Ambrish Srivastava (VP, IR) and Amitesh Bajad (Director, IR). The company noted that visibility has improved with LTAs now in place with all top five hyperscalers into H1:26 (two extending into FY27). Notably, the HDD market is structurally different from previous cycles and showing better pricing than the \(\sim 7\%\) ASP base case decline outlined at their Investor Day. Not only has capacity tightened (\~50M units vs. \(\sim 80M\) during the peak), but the market is also shifting to EB- based terms. WDC also provided an update on HAMR, and that areal density development is ahead of plan. Though it's worth noting, that the company is also expanding their UltraSMR products - which provides \(\sim 20\%\) capacity uplift at no incremental cost. WDC expects UltraSMR to make up \(\sim 50\%\) of nearline by end- CY25, which should be margin accretive—though there may be some variability sequentially due to customer implementation and timing. Longer term, HDD growth is expected to remain favorable as they remain essential for cloud storage (\~85% of data) alongside SSDs in tiered AI/inferencing architectures. On the balance sheet and cash flow side, WDC intends to sell its remaining SanDisk shares by February as it delivers toward 1- 1.5x net leverage and return 100% of excess cash over time.

ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW: We had the opportunity to meet with several executives from MSI's management team including CEO Greg Brown, CFO Jason Winkler, Jack Molloy (COO), Uygar Gazioglu (SVP - Treasurer, Tax & IR), and Tim Yocum/Vicki Tzolov from Investor Relations at their HQ. During the event, MSI discussed attractive opportunities for the company presented by the recent \$4.4B acquisition of Silvus (which was completed earlier this month), strong demand/budget backdrop across public sector customers (and potential tailwinds form OBBBA), product innovation-led growth across all three technologies, margin expansion levers (despite tariff headwinds), and M&A framework among other topics. We walked away from the meetings with incremental confidence in overall end demand fundamentals and MSI's ability to accelerate product orders growth in H2 (these were two key concerns for investors). More importantly, the meetings reinforced our view that Silvus will be a transformative asset for MSI that will provide the company with a more entrenched position in the defense vertical. Sticking with OP rating and raising target to \$525 to reflect our more positive stance on the company's NT and LT growth prospects within their core businesses and Silvus.

Attractive Accretion from Silvus in CY26 Despite Need to Invest: Silvus currently generates \$475M in annual revenue for CY25 should grow \(\sim 20\%\) in 2026 (despite expectations for lower Ukraine- related revenue). The asset is expected to be EPS neutral and \(\sim \$ 0.20\) accretive EPS next year despite incremental headcount investments needed to build sales headcount for federal, international go- to- market, government affairs, and R&D organizations. Silvus should benefit from being under the Motorola umbrella and be able to leverage the acquirer's global presence (120 countries) and relationships with defense customers. Currently, Silvus is mostly a product company; MSI sees potential wrap software/services as part of Silvus's offering in the future.

Initial claims improved a touch this week, remaining in a sideways trend. But with both the hires rate and quits rate moving lower, the labor market is showing some signs of moderation. Stan Shipley estimates payroll employment increases +115k in Aug.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Time of dissemination: August 30 2025 12:00 PM ET

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:

Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. In Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances. Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
"Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
